meanings.definition: To cover or decorate with panels.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter is repanelling the walls of the room with beautiful wooden panels.
meanings.sent2: She decided to repanel the old cabinet with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: The artist repanelled the plain door with colorful panels, turning it into a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The decorator repanelled the entire room, transforming it into a cozy space.
meanings.sent5: Repanelling the ceiling with intricate designs added a touch of elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: To replace or repair panels on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The maintenance crew is repanelling the damaged wall after the storm.
meanings.sent2: They had to repanel the floor of the stage before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The team had to repanel the boat quickly before it could set sail.
meanings.sent4: The workers repanelled the fence, making it sturdy and secure once again.
meanings.sent5: Repanelling the roof of the house was necessary to prevent leaks during the rainy season.
